1.name: Rage
1.description: Enter a primal rage as a Bonus Action, granting bonus damage, resistance to physical damage, advantage on Strength checks/saves, and preventing spellcasting or Concentration. Can be used 2 times (regain on rest), lasts 1 round and can be extended each turn by attacking, forcing a save, or using a Bonus Action (up to 10 minutes).

1.name: Unarmored Defense
1.description: While not wearing armor, AC = 10 + Dex mod + Con mod. Can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

1.name: Weapon Mastery
1.description: Choose 2 kinds of simple or martial melee weapons to unlock their Mastery properties. You can change one choice after each Long Rest. At higher Barbarian levels, you gain additional weapon Mastery choices.

2.name: Danger Sense
2.description: Advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects you can see (traps, spells) as long as you aren’t incapacitated.

2.name: Reckless Attack
2.description: When you make your first attack on a turn, you can choose to attack recklessly, granting you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during that turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.

3.name: Barbarian Subclass
3.description: Choose a Barbarian subclass (Path of the Berserker is available in the SRD). Subclass features are gained at levels 3, 6, 10, 14.

3.name: Primal Knowledge
3.description: Gain proficiency in one additional skill from the Barbarian skill list. Also, while raging, you can use Strength for certain skill checks (Acrobatics, Intimidation, Perception, Stealth, Survival) instead of the normal ability.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two scores by 1 (to a max of 20), or take a feat.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

5.name: Fast Movement
5.description: Your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren’t wearing heavy armor.

6.name: Subclass Feature
6.description: You gain a feature from your Barbarian subclass (Path of the Berserker: Mindless Rage).

7.name: Feral Instinct
7.description: You have advantage on initiative rolls. Also, if you are surprised at the beginning of combat and not incapacitated, you can act normally on your first turn but only if you enter your Rage first.

7.name: Instinctive Pounce
7.description: As part of the bonus action you use to enter Rage, you can move up to half your speed.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

9.name: Brutal Strike
9.description: Once per turn when you hit with a melee weapon using Strength, you can roll one additional weapon damage die (extra die increases at higher levels). (Improves at lv 13 and 17.)

10.name: Subclass Feature
10.description: You gain a feature from your Barbarian subclass (Path of the Berserker: Retaliation).

11.name: Relentless Rage
11.description: If you drop to 0 HP while raging and don’t die outright, you can make a DC 10 Con save to drop to 1 HP instead. DC increases by 5 each subsequent use until rest.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

13.name: Improved Brutal Strike
13.description: Your Brutal Strike extra damage die increases to two dice.

14.name: Subclass Feature
14.description: You gain a feature from your Barbarian subclass (Path of the Berserker: Intimidating Presence).

15.name: Persistent Rage
15.description: Your Rage only ends early if you fall unconscious or choose to end it; being inactive or not attacking no longer ends your rage.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

17.name: Improved Brutal Strike
17.description: Your Brutal Strike extra damage increases to 2d10, and you can apply two different Brutal Strike effects when you use it.

18.name: Indomitable Might
18.description: If your total for a Strength check is less than your Strength score, you can use your Strength score in place of the total.

19.name: Epic Boon
19.description: You gain one Epic Boon feat of your choice (Epic Boon of Irresistible Offense is recommended).

20.name: Primal Champion
20.description: Your Strength and Constitution scores each increase by 4, up to a maximum of 25.

1.name: Bardic Inspiration
1.description: You have a d6 Bardic Inspiration die. As a Bonus Action, grant one creature within 60 feet that can hear you one Bardic Inspiration die. Once within 10 minutes, that creature can add the d6 to a damage roll, d20 Test, or saving throw. (Inspiration die increases in size at higher levels.)

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: You can cast Bard spells. You know 2 cantrips and 4 level-1 spells from the Bard spell list at 1st level. Charisma is your spellcasting ability. (You prepare a number of spells equal to your slots, and can replace known cantrips on level-ups.)

2.name: Expertise
2.description: Choose two of your skill proficiencies; your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.

2.name: Jack of All Trades
2.description: You can add +1/2 of your proficiency bonus (rounded down) to any ability check you make that doesn’t already include your proficiency bonus.

3.name: Bard Subclass
3.description: Choose a Bard subclass (College of Lore is available in the SRD). You gain subclass features at 3, 6, 10, 14.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

5.name: Font of Inspiration
5.description: You regain all expended uses of Bardic Inspiration when you finish a Short or Long Rest (instead of only on Long Rest).

5.name: Peerless Skill (College of Lore feature)
5.description: *(Lore Bard 14th-level feature: not a base Bard feature.)*

6.name: Subclass Feature
6.description: You gain a feature from your Bard subclass (College of Lore: Magical Discoveries).

7.description: No new feature at Bard 7 (just spell slot progression).

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

9.description: No new feature (Bard spell progression continues).

10.name: Subclass Feature
10.description: You gain a feature from your Bard subclass (College of Lore: Peerless Skill).

11.description: No new base feature (spell progression continues).

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

14.name: Subclass Feature
14.description: You gain a feature from your Bard subclass.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

19.name: Epic Boon
19.description: Gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat of your choice (Boon of Fate is recommended for Bards).

20.name: Superior Inspiration
20.description: When you roll initiative and have no uses of Bardic Inspiration left, you regain one use.

options: Leather Armor, 2 Daggers, one Musical Instrument, Entertainer’s Pack, 19 GP

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: You can cast Cleric spells. You know three cantrips (e.g. Guidance, Sacred Flame, Thaumaturgy recommended). You prepare a list of cleric spells equal to your Wisdom mod + Cleric level (minimum 1). You can change prepared spells after each Long Rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability.

1.name: Divine Order
1.description: Choose a Divine Order that shapes your clergy training (not detailed in SRD excerpt; likely affects future features such as Channel Divinity options).

2.name: Channel Divinity
2.description: You gain the ability to channel divine energy. At 2nd level, you have one use (regained on Long Rest). Your base Channel option is Turn Undead: As an Action, present holy symbol to force undead within 30 ft to make a Wisdom save or be Turned (cannot approach you, etc.) for 1 minute or until damaged. Additional Channel options come from your Cleric subclass.

3.name: Cleric Subclass
3.description: Choose a Cleric subclass (Divine Domain, e.g. Life Domain). Subclass features gained at 3, 6, 10, 14, 17.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

5.name: Sear Undead
5.description: When you use Turn Undead (Channel Divinity), each undead of CR 1/2 or lower that fails its save is instantly destroyed (higher CR thresholds for destroy increase at higher levels).

6.name: Subclass Feature
6.description: You gain a feature from your Cleric subclass (Life Domain: Blessed Healer).

7.description: No new base feature (higher-level spell slots become available).

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

9.description: No new base feature (spell progression continues).

10.name: Subclass Feature
10.description: You gain a feature from your Cleric subclass (Life Domain: Divine Strike or Supreme Healing, depending on domain).

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

14.name: Subclass Feature
14.description: You gain a feature from your Cleric subclass (Life Domain: perhaps improved domain feature).

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

17.name: Subclass Feature
17.description: You gain a feature from your Cleric subclass (Life Domain: Supreme Healing if not earlier).

19.name: Epic Boon
19.description: Gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat (Boon of Fate recommended).

20.name: Greater Divine Intervention
20.description: Your Divine Intervention feature (if any from subclass or class) improves (usually allowing a Wish spell effect once per week, if following 2014 PHB pattern for Cleric).

options: Chain Shirt, Shield, Mace, Holy Symbol, Priest’s Pack, 7 GP

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: You have learned Druidic magic drawn from nature. You know 2 cantrips and can prepare Druid spells each day (Wisdom is your spellcasting ability). You can cast prepared spells using your spell slots.

1.name: Druidic
1.description: You know Druidic, a secret language of druids. You can speak it and use it to leave hidden messages that only other druids can perceive.

1.name: Primal Order
1.description: Choose a Primal Order (circle) influencing your druidic training (not fully detailed in SRD excerpt).

2.name: Wild Shape
2.description: As a Magic action, you can expend a use of Wild Shape to transform into a Beast you have seen (CR 0 or 1/4 at starting levels). You can use Wild Shape twice per rest. (Lasts for hours equal to half your Druid level, etc.)

2.name: Wild Companion
2.description: You can expend a use of Wild Shape to cast Find Familiar without material components.

3.name: Druid Subclass
3.description: Choose a Druid Circle (Circle of the Land is available in SRD). Subclass features at 3, 6, 10, 14.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

5.name: Wild Resurgence
5.description: You regain one expended use of Wild Shape whenever you finish a Short Rest (allowing additional transformations).

6.name: Subclass Feature
6.description: You gain a feature from your Druid subclass (Circle of the Land: e.g. Land’s Stride or Nature’s Ward).

7.name: Elemental Fury
7.description: Once per Long Rest, you can expend both uses of Wild Shape at the same time to transform into an Air, Earth, Fire, or Water elemental (as per Elemental Wild Shape).

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

9.description: No new base feature (spell progression continues).

10.name: Subclass Feature
10.description: You gain a feature from your Druid subclass (Circle of the Land: Nature’s Sanctuary or similar).

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

14.name: Subclass Feature
14.description: You gain a feature from your Druid subclass.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

18.name: Beast Spells
18.description: You can cast many of your Druid spells while in Wild Shape form (no material components).

19.name: Epic Boon
19.description: Gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat (Boon of the Night Spirit recommended).

20.name: Archdruid
20.description: You can use Wild Shape an unlimited number of times. Additionally, you no longer need to provide material components for Druid spells that lack a cost.

options: Leather Armor, Shield, Sickle, Druidic Focus, Explorer’s Pack, Herbalism Kit, 9 GP

1.name: Fighting Style
1.description: You gain a Fighting Style feat of your choice (such as Defense, Archery, etc.). Whenever you gain a Fighter level, you can replace this Fighting Style with another.

1.name: Second Wind
1.description: On your turn, you can use a Bonus Action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your Fighter level. Once used, this cannot be used again until you finish a Short or Long Rest.

1.name: Weapon Mastery
1.description: You unlock the Mastery properties of 3 kinds of weapons of your choice (simple or martial). You can change one choice after each Long Rest. (Fighters get more Mastery choices at higher levels as shown on the Fighter table.)

2.name: Action Surge (one use)
2.description: On your turn, you can take one additional action on top of your regular action and possible bonus action. Once you use this, you must finish a Short or Long Rest before you can use Action Surge again. (You gain an additional use at higher levels.)

2.name: Tactical Mind
2.description: When you fail an ability check, you can expend Second Wind (instead of healing) to roll 1d10 and add it to the check, potentially turning failure into success (if it still fails, Second Wind isn’t spent).

3.name: Fighter Subclass
3.description: Choose a Fighter subclass (Martial Archetype, e.g. Champion). Subclass features at 3, 7, 10, 15, 18.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

5.name: Tactical Shift
5.description: When you use Second Wind as a Bonus Action, you can also move up to half your speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

6.name: Ability Score Improvement
6.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

7.name: Subclass Feature
7.description: You gain a feature from your Fighter subclass (Champion: Remarkable Athlete or Additional Fighting Style).

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

9.name: Indomitable (one use)
9.description: When you fail a saving throw, you can reroll it with a bonus equal to your Fighter level and must use the new roll. Once used, can’t use again until Long Rest (two uses at level 13, three at 17).

9.name: Tactical Master
9.description: When you attack with a weapon that you have Mastery with, you can replace its mastery property with Push, Sap, or Slow for that attack.

10.name: Subclass Feature
10.description: You gain a feature from your Fighter subclass (Champion: Improved Critical range 18–20, or Heroic Warrior for Champion in 2024 rules).

11.name: Two Extra Attacks
11.description: You can attack three times whenever you take the Attack action (instead of twice).

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

13.name: Indomitable (two uses)
13.description: You can use Indomitable twice between Long Rests.

13.name: Studied Attacks
13.description: If you miss on an attack roll against a creature, you have advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before end of your next turn.

14.name: Ability Score Improvement
14.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

15.name: Subclass Feature
15.description: You gain a feature from your Fighter subclass (Champion: Superior Critical on 18–20).

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

17.name: Indomitable (three uses)
17.description: You can use Indomitable three times between Long Rests.

17.name: Action Surge (two uses)
17.description: You can use Action Surge twice between rests, but only once per turn.

18.name: Subclass Feature
18.description: You gain a feature from your Fighter subclass (Champion: Survivor).

19.name: Epic Boon
19.description: Gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat (Boon of Combat Prowess recommended).

20.name: Three Extra Attacks
20.description: You can attack four times whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

options: Chain Mail, Greatsword, Flail, 8 Javelins, Dungeoneer’s Pack, 4 GP
Studded Leather Armor, Scimitar, Shortsword, Longbow & 20 arrows, Dungeoneer’s Pack, 11 GP

weapons: Martial weapons with the Light property
tools: One type of artisan’s tools or one musical instrument

1.name: Martial Arts
1.description: You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for unarmed strikes and monk weapons, roll a d6 in place of normal damage for unarmed/monk weapons (martial arts die increases with level), and make one unarmed strike as a Bonus Action if you attacked with unarmed or monk weapon. Monk weapons: simple melee weapons and martial melee weapons with Light property.

1.name: Unarmored Defense
1.description: While not wearing armor or wielding a shield, your AC = 10 + Dex mod + Wis mod.

2.name: Ki (Focus Points)
2.description: You have a pool of Focus (Ki) points (equal to your Monk level) to fuel special techniques. You regain all Focus points after a Short or Long Rest. Your Ki save DC = 8 + Prof + Wis mod.

2.name: Flurry of Blows
2.description: Immediately after you take the Attack action on your turn, you can spend 1 Focus Point to make two unarmed strikes as a Bonus Action.

2.name: Patient Defense
2.description: You can spend 1 Focus Point to take the Dodge action as a Bonus Action on your turn.

2.name: Step of the Wind
2.description: You can spend 1 Focus Point to take the Disengage or Dash action as a Bonus Action on your turn, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

3.name: Monk Subclass
3.description: Choose a Monastic Tradition (e.g. Way of the Open Hand). Subclass features at 3, 6, 11, 17.

3.name: Deflect Missiles
3.description: When you are hit by a ranged weapon attack, you can use your Reaction to reduce the damage by 1d10 + Dex mod + Monk level. If damage is reduced to 0, you can catch the projectile and spend 1 Focus Point to throw it back as part of the same Reaction (range 20/60, counts as monk weapon).

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

4.name: Slow Fall
4.description: You can use your Reaction when falling to reduce fall damage by an amount equal to 5 × your Monk level.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: You can attack twice instead of once when you take the Attack action.

5.name: Stunning Strike
5.description: When you hit another creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 Focus Point to attempt a stun. Target must succeed on a Con save or be Stunned until end of your next turn.

5.name: Focused Aim
5.description: When you miss an attack, you can spend 1–3 Focus Points to increase your attack roll by 2 per point spent, potentially turning the miss into a hit.

6.name: Subclass Feature
6.description: You gain a feature from your Monastic Tradition (Open Hand: Wholeness of Body).

7.name: Evasion
7.description: When you make a Dexterity save for half damage, you take no damage on a success and only half on a failure.

7.name: Stillness of Mind
7.description: You can use an Action to end one effect on yourself that is causing you to be Charmed or Frightened.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

9.name: Unarmored Movement Improvement
9.description: You gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces or across liquids on your turn without falling during the move.

10.name: Purity of Body
10.description: You have immunity to disease and poison (damage and condition).

11.name: Subclass Feature
11.description: You gain a feature from your Monastic Tradition (Open Hand: Fleet Step, or another 11th-level feature).

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

13.name: Tongue of the Sun and Moon
13.description: You understand all spoken languages, and any creature that knows a language can understand what you say.

14.name: Diamond Soul
14.description: Your mastery of ki grants proficiency in all saving throws. Additionally, if you fail a save, you can spend 1 Focus Point to reroll it and must use the new roll.

15.name: Timeless Body
15.description: You suffer none of the frailty of old age, and you can’t be aged magically. You still die of old age, and you require no food or water.

15.name: Perfect Focus
15.description: When you roll initiative and have fewer than 4 Focus Points, you regain Focus Points up to 4.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

17.name: Subclass Feature
17.description: You gain a feature from your Monastic Tradition (Open Hand: Quivering Palm).

18.name: Empty Body
18.description: You can use an Action and spend 4 Focus Points to become invisible for 1 minute and gain resistance to all damage except Force. You can also spend 8 Focus to cast Astral Projection on yourself (self only) without material components.

19.name: Epic Boon
19.description: Gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat (Boon of Irresistible Offense recommended).

20.name: Body and Mind
20.description: Your Dexterity and Wisdom scores each increase by 4, up to a max of 25.

options: Shortsword, 2 Handaxes, tools (artisan’s or musical) chosen for proficiency, Explorer’s Pack, 11 GP

1.name: Lay on Hands
1.description: You have a healing pool of HP equal to 5 × your Paladin level. As an Action, you can touch a creature and restore HP to it, drawing from your pool. Alternatively, you can expend 5 HP from the pool to cure the target of one disease or neutralize one poison. Regain all spent HP in pool after a Long Rest.

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: You can cast Paladin spells starting at 1st level. You prepare spells from the Paladin list equal to your Cha mod + half your Paladin level. Charisma is your spellcasting ability. (You also gain cantrips or other spellcasting features per revised rules.)

1.name: Weapon Mastery
1.description: You unlock the Mastery properties of 2 kinds of weapons of your choice (simple or martial). You can change one choice after each Long Rest.

2.name: Fighting Style
2.description: You gain a Fighting Style feat of your choice (Defense, Dueling, etc.).

2.name: Divine Smite
2.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal radiant damage to the target, in addition to weapon damage. The extra damage is 2d8 for a 1st-level slot, plus 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st, up to 5d8 total. The damage increases by 1d8 if the target is an Undead or Fiend.

3.name: Channel Divinity
3.description: You gain the ability to Channel Divinity. You have two options: Divine Sense (as an Action, detect celestials, fiends, undead within 60 ft) and your Paladin Subclass’s Channel Divinity option. You can use Channel Divinity once per Short or Long Rest.

3.name: Paladin Subclass
3.description: Choose a Paladin Oath (e.g., Oath of Devotion). Subclass features at 3, 6, 10, 14, 18.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action.

5.name: Faithful Steed
5.description: You always have the Find Steed spell prepared, and it doesn’t count against your number of prepared spells. You can cast it once without expending a spell slot, regaining this ability on a Long Rest.

6.name: Aura of Protection
6.description: You emanate a 10-foot aura. You and allies in the aura gain a bonus to saving throws equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum +1). This aura is inactive while you are incapacitated.

7.name: Subclass Feature
7.description: You gain a feature from your Paladin subclass (Oath of Devotion: Aura of Devotion, immunity to charmed for you and allies in aura).

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

9.name: Abjure Foes
9.description: You can expend a use of Channel Divinity (Magic action) to force a number of creatures equal to your Charisma mod within 60 ft to make Wisdom saves or be frightened for 1 minute (or until taking damage), similar to Turn the Unholy.

10.name: Aura of Courage
10.description: Your Aura of Protection now additionally grants you and allies immunity to the Frightened condition. (An ally already frightened who enters the aura is suppressed from fear while in it.)

11.name: Radiant Strikes
11.description: Whenever you hit a target with a melee weapon or unarmed strike, the target takes an extra 1d8 radiant damage.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

13.description: No new base feature (higher spell levels available).

14.name: Subclass Feature
14.description: You gain a feature from your Paladin subclass (Oath of Devotion: Cleansing Touch or Restoring Touch, e.g., remove certain conditions with Lay on Hands).

15.name: Restoring Touch
15.description: When you use Lay on Hands, you can additionally spend 5 points to remove one of the following conditions from the target: Blinded, Charmed, Deafened, Frightened, Paralyzed, Stunned.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

17.name: Subclass Feature
17.description: You gain a feature from your Paladin subclass (Oath of Devotion: likely an improved aura or sacred ability).

18.name: Aura Expansion
18.description: Your Aura of Protection (and Aura of Courage, if you have it) now has a 30-foot radius.

19.name: Epic Boon
19.description: Gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat (Boon of Truesight recommended).

20.name: Holy Nimbus
20.description: As a Bonus Action, you can empower your Aura of Protection for 10 minutes, gaining additional benefits: you and allies in the aura deal radiant damage to enemies starting their turn in it, you and allies have advantage on saves vs Fiends and Undead, and the aura is filled with bright sunlight. Once used, this can't be used again until you finish a Long Rest or expend a 5th-level spell slot to use it again.

options: Chain Mail, Shield, Longsword, 6 Javelins, Holy Symbol, Priest’s Pack, 9 GP
Studded Leather Armor, Shield, Scimitar, 2 Handaxes, Explorer’s Pack, 11 GP

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: You have learned to cast spells that harness nature’s essence. At 1st level, you know two 1st-level Ranger spells. You have spell slots as a 1/2 caster. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability. You prepare spells as a Ranger (two 1st-level spells at level 1).

2.name: Favored Enemy (deprecating to spell choices)
2.description: (*In 2024 rules, Rangers no longer have a static Favored Enemy; instead they have spells like Hunter's Mark always prepared.*) You always have the Hunter’s Mark spell prepared and can cast it without using a spell slot once per Long Rest. It doesn’t count against prepared spells.

2.name: Fighting Style
2.description: You gain a Fighting Style feat of your choice (Archery is common).

3.name: Ranger Subclass
3.description: Choose a Ranger subclass (e.g., Hunter). Subclass features at 3, 6, 10, 14.

3.name: Primal Awareness
3.description: You can focus your awareness to magically sense creatures. You always have certain spells prepared (like Speak with Animals, etc.) without counting against prepared spells. (Exact details vary; e.g., Primeval Awareness replaced by free spells in TCoE/2024.)

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: You can attack twice whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

6.name: Subclass Feature
6.description: You gain a feature from your Ranger subclass (Hunter: Defensive Tactics choice).

7.name: Fleet of Foot
7.description: You can take the Dash action as a Bonus Action on your turn.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

9.description: No new base feature (spell progression continues).

10.name: Subclass Feature
10.description: You gain a feature from your Ranger subclass (Hunter: Multiattack or Superior Hunter’s Prey).

11.name: Tireless
11.description: As an Action, you can give yourself temporary HP equal to 1d8 + Wis mod, and you can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per Long Rest. In addition, whenever you finish a Short Rest, your exhaustion level (if any) decreases by 1.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

14.name: Subclass Feature
14.description: You gain a feature from your Ranger subclass (Hunter: Superior Hunter’s Defense, e.g., Evasion-like benefit).

15.name: Nature’s Veil
15.description: As a Bonus Action, you can become Invisible until the start of your next turn. You can use this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per Long Rest.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

17.name: Foe Slayer
17.description: Once on each of your turns, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the attack roll or damage roll of an attack you make against one of your marked enemies (such as with Hunter’s Mark).

19.name: Epic Boon
19.description: Gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat (Boon of the Night Spirit recommended).

20.name: Foe Slayer (improved)
20.description: Your marked-target damage from Foe Slayer increases (for example, you might be able to apply it to every attack or increase Hunter’s Mark damage further at level 20).

options: Studded Leather Armor, Scimitar, Shortsword, Longbow & 20 arrows (with quiver), Druidic Focus (sprig of mistletoe), Explorer’s Pack, 7 GP

weapons: Martial weapons with the Finesse or Light property

1.name: Sneak Attack
1.description: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a finesse or ranged weapon and have advantage on the attack (or an ally is adjacent to the target), you deal an extra 1d6 damage. (Sneak Attack damage increases as you gain levels.)

1.name: Thieves’ Cant
1.description: You know Thieves’ Cant, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows you to hide messages in normal conversation and understand similar hidden messages.

2.name: Cunning Action
2.description: You can take a Bonus Action on each of your turns to Dash, Disengage, or Hide.

3.name: Rogue Subclass
3.description: Choose an archetype (Roguish Archetype) such as Thief. Subclass features at 3, 6, 10, 14.

3.name: Cunning Strike
3.description: When you deal Sneak Attack damage, you can forgo some of the extra dice to apply special effects. You gain two Cunning Strike options (like Trip, Disarm, etc.), and you can expend 1 or more of your Sneak Attack dice to use them. (More options unlocked at higher levels.)

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

5.name: Uncanny Dodge
5.description: When an attacker you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your Reaction to halve the attack’s damage against you.

6.name: Subclass Feature
6.description: You gain a feature from your Roguish Archetype (Thief: Fast Hands and Second-Story Work).

7.name: Evasion
7.description: When you make a Dexterity save for half damage, you take no damage on a success and only half damage on a failure.

7.name: Reliable Talent
7.description: Whenever you make an ability check with a skill or tool in which you have proficiency, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

9.name: Supreme Sneak
9.description: You gain an additional Cunning Strike option: Stealth Attack (cost 1d6): If you are Invisible due to Hiding and hit with a Sneak Attack, you do not lose the Invisible condition if you end your turn behind at least three-quarters cover.

10.name: Subclass Feature
10.description: You gain a feature from your Roguish Archetype (Thief: Use Magic Device).

11.name: Improved Cunning Strike
11.description: You can apply two different Cunning Strike effects when you hit with Sneak Attack, expending the required dice for each.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

13.name: Use Magic Device
13.description: You ignore all class, race, and level requirements on the use of magic items. You can attune up to four magic items at once. When using a magic item with charges, roll a d6 on expending the last charge: on a 6, it isn’t expended. You can use any spell scroll, rolling an Int (Arcana) check if the spell is above level 1. On success, you cast it; on failure, the scroll is wasted.

14.name: Subclass Feature
14.description: You gain a feature from your Roguish Archetype (Thief: Thief’s Reflexes – take two turns in the first round of combat).

15.name: Slippery Mind
15.description: You gain proficiency in Wisdom and Charisma saving throws (in addition to Dex, Int saves from base).

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

17.name: Elusive
17.description: Attack rolls against you cannot have advantage while you aren’t incapacitated.

19.name: Epic Boon
19.description: Gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat (Boon of the Night Spirit recommended).

20.name: Stroke of Luck
20.description: If you miss an attack or fail an ability check, you can treat the d20 roll as a 20. Once used, you regain this on a Short or Long Rest.

options: Leather Armor, 2 Daggers, Shortsword, Shortbow & 20 arrows (with quiver), Thieves’ Tools, Burglar’s Pack, 8 GP
Studded Leather Armor, 2 Handaxes, Rapier, Longbow & 20 arrows (with quiver), Thieves’ Tools, Explorer’s Pack, 8 GP

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: You have innate magical ability. You know 4 cantrips and 2 first-level spells of your choice from the Sorcerer spell list. You have 2 level-1 spell slots. Charisma is your spellcasting ability. You regain spell slots on Long Rest.

1.name: Sorcerous Origin
1.description: Choose a Sorcerer subclass (Sorcerous Origin) that grants features at 1, 6, 14, 18 (e.g., Draconic Sorcery).

2.name: Font of Magic (Sorcery Points)
2.description: You gain 2 Sorcery Points (increasing with level) to fuel Metamagic and other abilities. You regain all Sorcery Points after a Long Rest. You can also convert sorcery points to additional spell slots or vice versa (1st-level slot = 2 points, etc.).

3.name: Metamagic
3.description: You gain the ability to twist your spells. Choose two Metamagic options (e.g., Empowered Spell, Subtle Spell, etc.). You can use sorcery points to apply these effects to your spells. You gain another Metamagic option at 10th and 17th levels.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

5.description: No new base feature (spell progression continues).

6.name: Subclass Feature
6.description: You gain a feature from your Sorcerous Origin (Draconic Sorcery: Elemental Affinity, add Cha mod damage and resist that element).

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

10.name: Metamagic (Additional)
10.description: You learn one additional Metamagic option (for a total of three).

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

14.name: Subclass Feature
14.description: You gain a feature from your Sorcerous Origin (Draconic Sorcery: Dragon Wings for flight).

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

17.name: Metamagic (Additional)
17.description: You learn one additional Metamagic option (for a total of four).

18.name: Subclass Feature
18.description: You gain a feature from your Sorcerous Origin (Draconic Sorcery: Dragon Companion, cast Summon Dragon without components or slot).

19.name: Epic Boon
19.description: Gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat (Boon of Spell Recall recommended).

20.name: Sorcerous Restoration
20.description: Upon finishing a Short Rest, you regain 4 expended Sorcery Points.

options: Light Crossbow & 20 bolts, 2 Daggers, Arcane Focus (Crystal), Dungeoneer’s Pack, 28 GP
Studded Leather Armor, Shield, Scimitar, 2 Handaxes, Explorer’s Pack, 11 GP

1.name: Otherworldly Patron
1.description: You forge a pact with an otherworldly Patron (e.g., Fiend). Your patron grants you features at 1, 6, 10, 14 (and invocations access).

1.name: Pact Magic
1.description: You have a limited number of spell slots (of higher level scaling more quickly). At 1st level, you have one 1st-level Pact Magic slot. You know 2 spells from the Warlock list and 2 cantrips. All Pact Magic slots are of the same level (max 5th). You regain slots on a Short or Long Rest.

1.name: Eldritch Invocations
1.description: You learn magical invocations—fragments of forbidden knowledge. At 1st level you know 1 Invocation (e.g., Pact of the Tome). You gain more at higher levels. Invocations provide various benefits; some require prerequisites.

2.name: Eldritch Invocations (Additional)
2.description: You learn an additional Eldritch Invocation (for a total of 2 at level 2).

3.name: Pact Boon
3.description: Your patron bestows a gift. Choose one: Pact of the Chain (familiar), Pact of the Blade (bonded weapon), or Pact of the Tome (grimoire of cantrips).

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

5.name: Eldritch Invocations (Additional)
5.description: You learn another Eldritch Invocation (total 3). Some invocations have minimum Warlock level requirements.

6.name: Subclass Feature
6.description: You gain a feature from your Patron (Fiend Patron: Dark One’s Own Luck – add 1d10 to an ability check or save, once per rest).

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

10.name: Subclass Feature
10.description: You gain a feature from your Patron (Fiend: Fiendish Resilience – choose one damage type after each rest to gain resistance to it).

11.name: Mystic Arcanum (6th level spell)
11.description: You gain a single 6th-level spell that you can cast once per Long Rest without using a spell slot. (Warlock's unique high-level spell feature.)

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

13.name: Mystic Arcanum (7th level spell)
13.description: You gain one 7th-level spell you can cast once per Long Rest without a slot.

14.name: Subclass Feature
14.description: You gain a feature from your Patron (Fiend: Hurl Through Hell – once per turn when you hit a creature, you can banish it to a hellish plane, dealing 10d10 psychic on return; 1/Long Rest or by expending a Pact slot to do again).

15.name: Mystic Arcanum (8th level spell)
15.description: You gain one 8th-level spell to cast once per Long Rest without a slot.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

17.name: Mystic Arcanum (9th level spell)
17.description: You gain one 9th-level spell to cast once per Long Rest without a slot.

18.name: Subclass Feature
18.description: You gain a feature from your Patron (Patron-specific high-level feature; Fiend: possibly additional spell or ability).

19.name: Epic Boon
19.description: Gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat (Boon of Irresistible Offense recommended).

20.name: Eldritch Master
20.description: As an Action, once per Long Rest, you can regain all your Pact Magic spell slots without resting.

options: Leather Armor, 2 Daggers, Arcane Focus (Crystal), Dungeoneer’s Pack, 28 GP
Studded Leather Armor, Shield, Scimitar, 2 Handaxes, Explorer’s Pack, 11 GP

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: You have a spellbook containing spells. At 1st level, you have 3 cantrips and 6 level-1 spells in your spellbook (and you prepare a subset each day equal to Int mod + Wizard level). You have two 1st-level spell slots. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability. You can ritual-cast spells in your book. You can copy new spells into your book when you find them.

1.name: Ritual Adept
1.description: If you have a spell in your spellbook with the Ritual tag, you can cast it as a ritual ( +10 minutes) without preparing it.

1.name: Arcane Recovery
1.description: Once per day after a Short Rest, you can recover some expended spell slots with a combined level equal to or less than half your Wizard level (rounded up).

2.name: Arcane Tradition
2.description: Choose a Wizard subclass (Arcane Tradition, e.g. School of Evocation). Subclass features at 2, 6, 10, 14.

3.description: No new base feature (spell progression continues).

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

6.name: Subclass Feature
6.description: You gain a feature from your Arcane Tradition (Evocation: Sculpt Spells, allowing allies to automatically save/evade your evocation spells).

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

10.name: Subclass Feature
10.description: You gain a feature from your Arcane Tradition (Evocation: Empowered Evocation, add Int mod to one damage roll of evocation spells).

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

14.name: Subclass Feature
14.description: You gain a feature from your Arcane Tradition (Evocation: Overchannel, maximize damage of a lower-level spell at cost of self-damage if overused).

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase ability scores or take a feat.

18.name: Spell Mastery
18.description: Choose a 1st-level and a 2nd-level Wizard spell in your spellbook. You can cast those spells at their lowest level without expending a spell slot, provided they are prepared. With 8 hours of study, you can exchange these choices.

19.name: Epic Boon
19.description: Gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat (Boon of Spell Recall recommended).

20.name: Signature Spells
20.description: Choose two 3rd-level Wizard spells in your spellbook as signature spells. You always have them prepared, and you can cast each of them once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot.

options: 2 Daggers, Arcane Focus (Quarterstaff), Robe, Spellbook, Scholar’s Pack, 5 GP
Leather Armor, Shield, Scimitar, 2 Handaxes, Explorer’s Pack, 11 GP
